mods.note: David French Boyd joined the faculty of Louisiana State Seminary of Learning at Alexandria, Louisiana, in 1860 under the administration of William T. Sherman. After serving in the Confederate Army during the Civil War, he was appointed superintendent and later president of the Seminary by Governor J. Madison Wells. Boyd resigned this position in 1880, returning to the University in 1884.' Vállas, a Hungarian immigrant and math teacher at the seminary, was among the first faculty appointed.
